Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Athena wearing a Corinthian helmet. Mould-made and hollow with a crudely made back. Coarse red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica, organics and sand inclusions. Head only, back is missing and front is very poorly eroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published (Tremblai 1992, 279 no. 428, pl. 97 fig. 370). Parallel from Naukratis (Oxfiord, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-G.80). Tremblai, C. D’A. 1992. Athena en Égypte: syncrétisme iconographique et religieux. PhD Université Laval, Québec (UMI).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.228) (Phase 3)
